ratings.comment: It's a UEC class.. so he is bound by the SOA for exams. But Gordon cares a lot about students and is always available to help them. Prepares you well for the exams.

AS303 is undoubtedly time-consuming, but I would not say it is tough. It can be handled well by a good schedule of time (preview, study, and review). I am not a math person, and my grade is not that high, but I have to say Mr.Enderle is the best professor in my college career. He is very accessible and caring on pizza, even during the weekends.

303 is a tough class. Online textbook is provided, but you don't really need to read it if you use his review videos and take good lecture notes. Gordon knows his stuff, and can teach quite well, but he can go a little quickly sometimes. He's very accessible outside of class, and once you know him, really easy to approach. He is great with Piazza.
RMI 620 with Gordon was excellent. Everything you learn will be useful for wherever you go in life. Lectures were clear and Gordon was always available to answer questions.

Gordon, though a bit awkward at times, is an overall excellent teacher, especially for an intro class. Though some topics were difficult, Gordon was able to explain clearly. When he made mistakes, he corrected himself once he noticed. The class itself moves fairly quickly and there's a lot of homework, but it was great overall.

Gordon gives amazing lectures. His personal experience with Watson really helps students to understand the course and concepts better. The course itself is kinda tricky but it is totally doable. His office hour helps a lot and he responds to email quickly.

This class is very hard, but Gordon always explained the concepts well and gave us useful homework and feedback. He gave detailed to solutions to all the homework, tests, and quizzes, which was extremely useful. Always willing to help out when needed, and always super friendly. But I wouldn't take this class as a general elective.

I tired to cut Gordon some slack as the course itself is very difficult, but as the semester went on it became inexcusable. After every class we would receive a lengthy email correcting all the mistakes he made during lecture. I really believe he wants to help, but its impossible to get help from him as there is always 10+ people in every office hr
Gordon is a great professor. The course itself is hard.

I honestly do not like the RMI program at UW-Madison at all. They dont use textbooks and it comes down to lecture notes and that leads to not knowing what to study for on the exams. The homework took hours and had no clear direction so I always had to email the TA. Super annoying. Gordon cares about his students but this class needs discussion sec.

Gordon is a huge asset to UW-Madison. He has extensive experience which he uses to help make concepts clear. It's clear Gordon cares about his students and will take any extra necessary to make sure students don't fall behind. The homework for this class took a long-time but was valuable. The reading was boring. He likes pop-quizes.
